isis.stitle: CAB: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CAB DOORS

svcprocinfo.para: Doors are of all steel-welded construction with access panel and access plugs/openings (Item 2, Figure 14) for making hinge adjustments or removal as required. The door is mounted on concealed leaf type hinges and door adjustment is provided by enlarged holes in hinge leaves. Door stop is integral with upper hinge. Door striker pin is also adjustable on lock pillar. Service on the door and its components is covered in paragraphs which follow.

svcsubproc.title: Door Replacement
svcsubproc.para: When replacing a door on a vehicle, the door components will have to be removed from the old door and installed on the new door. Refer to the following to transfer components.

All the components ( Figure 14and Figure 15) will have to be removed and, if not usable, replaced and installed in the new door. Refer to the proper procedure for the component being removed/installed.

calloutgroup.callout1: 10. REMOTE CONTROL ROD (LATCH TO LOCK KNOB)
13. REMOTE CONTROL ROD (LATCH TO REMOTE CONTROL ASSEMBLY)
14. REMOTE CONTROL ROD (LATCH TO LOCK CYLINDER)

svcsubproc.title: Hardware and Trim
svcsubproc.para: Components of the door assembly can be removed while door is either on the cab or removed. After interior door hardware and trim is removed ( Figure 14), most components can be removed individually without having to remove other components for access ( Figure 15).

svcsubproc.title: Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 14for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step2.para: Remove socket head screws (Item 12) and remove the window regulator handle (Item 11) and door handle (Item 13).
Remove two screws and detach arm rest (Item 9).
Remove door trim panel screws and loosen door trim panel (Item 7) from door.

note.para: If vehicle is equipped with power window switches or courtesy light (in the door trim panel before December 5, 1994; after December 5, 1994, the power window switches are on the instrument panel and the courtesy light is on the hinge pillar), tilt the door trim panel away from door to expose wiring harness connectors. Mark the harness connectors for installation and disconnect harness connectors ( Figure 17).

step2.para: Remove door trim panel (Item 7) by lifting up on trim panel to disconnect it from the grab handle reinforcement (Item 6), then remove it from the door. Refer to Figure 16for premium door trim panel.
Remove two screws and detach the grab handle reinforcement (Item 6).
Remove the socket head screws (Item 12) and remove the window regulator handle (Item 11), door handle (Item 13) and door trim washers (Item 10).
Remove two screws and detach arm rest (Item 5).
Remove the manifest pocket/cover panel mounting screws and remove the watershield and manifest pocket/cover panel (Items 3 and 4).

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 14for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step2.para: Install the grab handle reinforcement (Item 6) and secure it with the two mounting screws.
Care should be taken when re-installing the trim panel (Item 7). Snap the panel onto the grab handle reinforcement (Item 6). Refer to Figure 16for premium door trim panel.

note.para: If vehicle is equipped with power windows or courtesy light (in the door trim panel before December 5, 1994; after December 5, 1994, the power window switches are on the instrument panel and the courtesy light is on the hinge pillar), tilt the door trim panel away from door to expose wiring harness connectors. Reconnect harness connectors as marked when disconnected during removal ( Figure 17), then install the trim panel as described in steps C, D and E below.

step2.para: Align door trim panel (Item 7) on the door and secure it with the door trim panel screws.
Position the arm rest (Item 9) in place on the door trim panel and secure it with the two mounting screws.
Install the window regulator handle (Item 11) and door handle (Item 13) and secure them with the socket head screws (Item 12).
Position the manifest pocket/cover panel and watershield (Items 3 and 4) in place and secure with the mounting screws.
Position the arm rest (Item 5) and secure it with the two mounting screws (Item 15). Tighten to 1.5 to 2 ft-lbs. (2 to 2.7 N·m).
Install the window regulator handle (Item 11), door handle (Item 13) and door trim washers (Item 10) and secure them with the socket head screws (Item 12).
